title: Medicare Payment Fix Passes With Strong Bipartisan Support
teaser: The "doc fix" bill passed just hours before doctors would have started seeing a 21 percent Medicare pay cut.
contentencoded:
Late last night, Congress did something rare: it passed bipartisan legislation with overwhelming support.

The bill, called the “doc fix,” permanently changes the Medicare payment system, and it passed just hours before doctors would have started seeing a 21 percent Medicare pay cut.

Here & Now’s Robin Young talks to Sarah Kliff, who covers healthcare for Vox, about how this will affect both doctors and patients.

Guest

  • Sarah Kliff, senior editor at Vox who covers healthcare. She tweets @sarahkliff.
